intro: Scabiosa columbaria var. brigantiaca, commonly known as the Italian heartsease, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe. It features delicate, pink to white flowers with a distinctive central tuft of filaments, resembling a heart shape. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or limestone areas. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly cultivated in gardens.
